p: To interpret the data in more detail, samples 48, 49, 50, 55, 31, 32, 43, 42 and 30, all of them with isotopologue excess values over 2.5% were chosen ( Figure 3 and Table 1). Values for the isotopomers M+2 and M+3 and their ratios for both camphor and cineole are presented in Table 1. In all of these samples, the M+1 to M+3 fraction ranged from 25â€“73% of total labelled excess isotopologues.
